page.title: 03COCHNO FARM,HARDGATE.
page.content: On the lower slopes of the Kilpatrick Hills between 150m. and 300m. above sea level were large estates belonging to the owners of the mills of Hardgate After World War II Cochno estate was sold to Glasgow University and is now used by their school of Veterinary Medicine as a farm where their students can learn about animals. It takes three hours to walk round the perimeter of the farm as it's area is seventy one hectares.Because the farm is in the West of Scotland they can grow only grass-it is too wet to grow crops like barley and wheat -so they have grazing animals such as cows and sheep.There are 40 Herefords and 100 Fresians which produce 1500 litres of milk a day.They also have a piggery goats and donkeys. They experiment with animal feeds and treat sick animals too.
